comment_text: Just to clarify, only the black MINUS SYMBOL will disappear, not the whole box behind it. If you're doing it right, your brain will fill in the box as completely white once you've hit the blind spot, as it tries to "fill in" the missing information based on what's surrounding it.

Another way this can be done is with your thumb.

Close one eye (keeping with the video, the right eye) and focus on a fixed point, say on a wall. Don't move your eye.
Now, hold your arm fully out and only have your thumb up. Position your thumb to being equal to that of the fixed point, then move the your arm to that side of your vision (in this case, to the left). Your thumb should disappear from view.

For me, the distance between the fixed point and where there is no vision is about 8 inches. But that is dependent on the length of your arms. I stand at 6'2"(1.87m), so, my arms are kinda long.
